summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Dallas Transportation and Infrastructure Committee will hold a special called meeting on May 20, 2024, at 12:00 PM. The meeting will take place in the Council Chambers at City Hall and will also be available via video conference. The primary purpose is to conduct interviews for candidates appointed to the DART Board.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The main focus of the meeting is the interviews of candidates for the DART Board. This process is crucial for selecting representatives who will influence transportation decisions and policies in the Dallas area.

**Important Details**:  
The meeting will be broadcast live on Spectrum Cable Channel 16 and online. The public is invited to attend either in person or virtually. The agenda includes provisions for an executive session if necessary, covering topics such as legal advice on pending litigation and deliberations on personnel matters.

**Action Items**:  
The committee seeks to finalize the selection of candidates for the DART Board through these interviews. Approval of the recommended candidates will be sought following the interviews, which will play a significant role in shaping the future of transportation infrastructure in Dallas. 

This meeting is essential for ensuring that qualified individuals are appointed to the DART Board, which directly impacts public transportation services in the city.
